Indeed it's the problem of LD_LIBRARY_PATH. I reported the problem to my system administrator, and he offered a solution that works:

module load gcc

Comparing before and after loading gcc, the LD_LIBRARY_PATH does change. After loading the module, the following paths have been prepended to the PATH.

/usr/local/compilers/gcc/4.9.0/lib/gcc/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/4.9.0
/usr/local/compilers/gcc/4.9.0/lib64
/usr/local/compilers/gcc/4.9.0/lib

body:
Indeed it's the problem of `LD_LIBRARY_PATH`. I reported the problem to my system administrator, and he offered a solution that works:

`module load gcc`

Comparing before and after loading gcc, the `LD_LIBRARY_PATH` does change. After loading the module, the following paths have been prepended to the PATH.

```
/usr/local/compilers/gcc/4.9.0/lib/gcc/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/4.9.0
/usr/local/compilers/gcc/4.9.0/lib64
/usr/local/compilers/gcc/4.9.0/lib
```
